com.yworks.yfiles.layout.router.polyline

Class AbstractSegmentInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.layout.router.polyline.AbstractSegmentInfo
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CellSegmentInfo, SegmentInfo

    public abstract class AbstractSegmentInfo
extends Object
    This class stores location information for orthogonal edge segments.

    Most notably, AbstractSegmentInfo stores the direction to which the segment points and the interval describing possible locations and extensions of a segment.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractSegmentInfo

        protected AbstractSegmentInfo(Edge edge,
                              int segmentIndex,
                              Direction direction,
                              Interval locationRange,
                              Interval minExtension,
                              Interval maxExtension)
        Creates a new instance of AbstractSegmentInfo.
        Parameters:
        edge - the edge to which the segment of this info belongs
        segmentIndex - the index of the segment to which this info belongs
        direction - the direction to which the segment of this info points
        locationRange - the range within which the common location of this segment has to lie
        minExtension - the minimum interval in extension direction this segment is known to intersect
        maxExtension - the maximum interval in extension direction this segment will span

      • AbstractSegmentInfo

        protected AbstractSegmentInfo(Edge edge,
                              int segmentIndex,
                              LineSegment segment)
        Creates a new instance of AbstractSegmentInfo using a line segment to describe the edge segment.

        This constructor is meant to be used for fixed orthogonal edge segments.

        Parameters:
        edge - the edge to which this segment info belongs
        segmentIndex - the index of the segment to which this info belongs
        segment - a line segment describing the edge segment

    • Method Detail

      • getDirection

        public Direction getDirection()
        Gets the Direction to which the segment of this info points.
        Returns:
        the direction to which the segment of this info points

      • getEdge

        public Edge getEdge()
        Gets the edge to which the segment of this info belongs.
        Returns:
        the edge to which the segment of this info belongs

      • getLocation

        public double getLocation()
        Gets the fixed location within the location range for this segment info.

        For horizontal segments, this is the vertical location; for vertical segments, this is the horizontal location.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the segment info already has a fixed location
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given location does not lie within the location range
        Default Value:
        The default value is 0. No fixed location for the segment info has been set.
        Returns:
        the fixed location that has been set before or 0 if no fixed location has been set
        See Also:
        isFixed(), getLocationRange(), setLocation(double)

      • getLocationRange

        public Interval getLocationRange()
        Gets the range, i.e., the interval within which the segment should be placed.

        For horizontal segments, this is the range containing the vertical location; for vertical segments, this is the range containing the horizontal location.

        Returns:
        the interval within which the segment should be placed

      • getMaxExtension

        public Interval getMaxExtension()
        Gets the maximum extension that this segment can span.

        For horizontal intervals, this is the maximum horizontal extension; for vertical intervals, this is the maximum vertical extension.

        Returns:
        the maximum extension that this segment can span

      • getMinExtension

        public Interval getMinExtension()
        Gets the minimum known extension of the segment, i.e., the minimum interval that this segment will cover in any case.

        For horizontal intervals, this is the minimum horizontal extension; for vertical intervals, this is the minimum vertical extension.

        Returns:
        the minimum extension of the segment or null if no minimum extension can be determined

      • getPreferredAlignment

        public Alignment getPreferredAlignment()
        Gets the preferred placement of this segment within its location range.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an unknown alignment is given
        Default Value:
        The default value is Alignment.ANY. The segment can be placed anywhere within its location range.
        Returns:
        one of the predefined alignments
        See Also:
        setPreferredAlignment(Alignment)

      • getSegmentGroup

        public SegmentGroup getSegmentGroup()
        Gets the segment group to which this segment info belongs.

        When defining the segment group, the location range will be adjusted to use the common interval of the segment group.

        Returns:
        the segment group to which this segment info belongs or null if no segment group is assigned
        See Also:
        SegmentGroup.getCommonLocationRange(), setSegmentGroup(SegmentGroup)

      • getSegmentIndex

        public int getSegmentIndex()
        Gets the index of the segment of this info.
        Returns:
        the index of the segment of this info

      • isFixed

        public boolean isFixed()
        Gets whether or not this segment info is fixed, i.e., a fixed location has been determined within its location range.
        Returns:
        true if this segment info has a fixed location assigned to it, false otherwise

      • isVertical

        public boolean isVertical()
        Gets whether or not the associated segment is vertical.
        Returns:
        true if the segment of this segment info is vertical, false if it is horizontal

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(double value)
        Sets the fixed location within the location range for this segment info.

        For horizontal segments, this is the vertical location; for vertical segments, this is the horizontal location.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the segment info already has a fixed location
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given location does not lie within the location range
        Default Value:
        The default value is 0. No fixed location for the segment info has been set.
        Parameters:
        value - the fixed location that has been set before or 0 if no fixed location has been set
        See Also:
        isFixed(), getLocationRange(), getLocation()

      • setPreferredAlignment

        public void setPreferredAlignment(Alignment value)
        Sets the preferred placement of this segment within its location range.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if an unknown alignment is given
        Default Value:
        The default value is Alignment.ANY. The segment can be placed anywhere within its location range.
        Parameters:
        value - one of the predefined alignments
        See Also:
        getPreferredAlignment()

      • setSegmentGroup

        public void setSegmentGroup(SegmentGroup value)
        Sets the segment group to which this segment info belongs.

        When defining the segment group, the location range will be adjusted to use the common interval of the segment group.

        Parameters:
        value - the segment group to which this segment info belongs or null if no segment group is assigned
        See Also:
